noun.description: The fact of being who or what a person or thing is.
examples: he knows the identity of the bombers
she believes she is the victim of mistaken identity
the initiative created an identity between the city and the suburbs

noun.description: A transformation that leaves an object unchanged.
The equality of two expressions for all values of the quantities expressed by letters, or an equation expressing this, e.g. (x + 1)² = x² + 2x + 1.

origin: Late 16th century (in the sense quality of being identical): from late Latin identitas, from Latin idem same.
